definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
to expose (photography)/(fig.) to expose (a scandal)/(advertising) exposure/Taiwan pr. [pu4 guang1]
to expose (to the air, light etc)/to leave uncovered/exposure
one day's sun, ten days' frost (idiom, from Mencius); fig. to work for a bit then skimp/sporadic effort/lack of sticking power/short attention span
Yesou Puyan or Humble Words of a Rustic Elder, monumental Qing novel by Xia Jingqu 夏敬渠[Xia4 Jing4 qu2]

sentences.english: If a subject contains a lot of white, it can easily be overexposed.
sentences.chinese: 如果被攝物體有很多的白色，就很有可能過曝。

sentences.english: But with negative film, especially color negative, you're better off overexposing by one stop.
sentences.chinese: 不過對於負片，尤其是彩色負片，最好加曝一檔。

sentences.english: Conversely, if the histogram skews towards the right, then the image is potentially overexposed.
sentences.chinese: 相反的，如果直方圖集中在右側，說明圖像過曝。

sentences.english: But with negative film, especially color negative, you're better off overexposing by one stop.
sentences.chinese: 而對負片，特別是彩色負片，最好增曝一檔。

sentences.english: Love the flower shot with against sunlight and over exposure recently.
sentences.chinese: 最近拍花喜歡上逆光加上過曝出來的感覺。

sentences.english: Steve's talking about how much they love their users.
sentences.chinese: 現在喬布斯在自曝他有多熱愛他們的用戶。

definition: to expose (photography)/(fig.) to expose (a scandal)/(advertising) exposure/Taiwan pr. [pu4 guang1]
to burst out/to appear unexpectedly/to break (media story)
(of video clips, rumors etc) to circulate on the Internet
foreign news media/abbr. of 外國媒體|外国媒体
to give orders/to spread news or rumors/to leak certain information intentionally
to terminate an agreement/to cancel a contract
